intro: Oxytropis salangensis, commonly known as Salang Hill Pea, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, including parts of Afghanistan, Pakistan, and Tajikistan. The plant is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and trifoliate leaves, which are typically small and heart-shaped. Its flowers are usually purple or violet, arranged in dense clusters, and it produces small, elongated pods containing several seeds. Oxytropis salangensis is adapted to high-altitude environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky areas.
